chapterTitle: Financial Statements, Taxes, and Cash Flow

columns.text: This exercise requires us to prepare the 2018 balance sheet for Rogers Corp.
**Balance sheet** is a financial statement that reports a company's assets, liabilities, and shareholders' equity at a specific period.

Let's identify the given amounts in the problem.


<center>

| |Amounts ($) | 
|--|--:| 
| Cash| 127,000| 
| Patents and copyrights  | 660,000| 
| Accounts payable|210,000 | 
|Accounts receivable  |115,000 | 
| Tangible net fixed assets| 1,610,000 | 
|  Inventory  |286,000 | 
| Notes payable |155,000 | 
|Accumulated retained earnings  |1,368,000 | 
| Long-term debt |830,000 |

Before, we prepare the balance sheet, we need to compute first the common stock using the following equation.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{CS} &= \text{TA} - {\text{TL}}- {\text{ARE}}\\[1pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

CS = Common Stock
TA = Total Assets
TL = Total Liabilities
ARE = Accumulated Retained Earnings

Let's now identify the Total Assets.

$$\begin {array}{lrr}
\text{Cash}&\$\hspace{5pt}\text{127,000}\\
\text{Patents and copyrights}&\text{660,000}\\
\text{Accounts receivable}&\text{115,000}\\
\text{Tangible net fixed assets}&\text{1,610,000}\\
\text{Inventory}&\underline{\hspace{14pt}\text{286,000}}\\
\text{Total Assets}&\underline{\underline{\$\hspace{5pt}\text{2,798,000}}}\\
\end{array}$$

Hence, the total assets are $2,798,000.

The total liabilities must be identified next.

$$\begin {array}{lrr}
\text{Accounts Payable}&\$\hspace{5pt}\text{210,000}\\
\text{Notes Payable}&\text{155,000}\\
\text{Long-term debt}&\underline{\hspace{14pt}\text{830,000}}\\
\text{Total Liabilities}&\underline{\underline{\$\hspace{5pt}\text{1,195,000}}}\\
\end{array}$$

Hence, the total liabilities are $1,195,000.

The 2018 balance sheet for Rogers Corp. is presented below:

$$\begin {array}{c}
\textbf{Rogers Corp.}\\
\textbf{Balance Sheet}\\
\textbf{As of December 31, 2018}
\end{array}$$
$$\begin {array}{llr}
\underline{\text{Assets}}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Cash}&&\$\text{\hspace{15pt}{127,000}}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Accounts receivable}&&\text{115,000}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Inventory}&&\underline{\text{286,000}}\\
\hspace{5pt}\text{Total Current Assets}&&&\text{\hspace{15pt}\$\hspace{5pt}528,000}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Tangible Net Fixed Asset}&&\text{1,610,000}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Patents and copyrights}&&\text{\underline{\hspace{15pt}{660,000}}}\\
\hspace{5pt}\text{Total Non-Current Assets}&&&\text{\underline{\hspace{15pt}2,270,000}}\\
\text{Total assets}&&&\underline{\underline{\$\hspace{5pt}\textbf{2,798,000}}}\\
\\
\underline{\text{Liabilities and Equity}}\\
\text{Liabilities}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Accounts payable }&&\$\hspace{10pt}\text{210,000}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Notes payable}&&\text{155,000}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Long-term debt}&&\underline{\text{830,000}}&\text{\$\hspace{5pt}1,195,000}\\
\text{Stockholders' Equity}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Common stock}&&\text{235,000}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Accumulated Retained earnings}&&\underline{\text{\hspace{10pt}1,368,000}}&\underline{\text{\hspace{10pt}1,603,000}}\\
\text{Total liabilities and equity}&&&\underline{\underline{\$\hspace{5pt}\textbf{2,798,000}}}\\
\end{array}$$
In this problem, we are required to prepare a balance for Rogers Corp.

Before we begin, let us first define balance sheet.

**Balance Sheet** is a statement which shows the assets, liabilities, and equity of a business for a period of time.

The 2018 balance sheet for Rogers Corp would look like this:

$$ 
\bold{Rogers~Corp.~}\\ 
\bold{Balance~Sheet}\\ 
\bold{For~ the ~Year~ Ended~ 2018}\\ $$

$$\begin{array}{cccc}\\
\begin{aligned}
&\text{Cash}&&&\text{\$127,000 }&\\
&\text{Accounts Receivable}&&&\text{115,000 }&\\
&\text{Inventory}&&&\text{286,000 }&\\
&\text{Tangible net fixed assets}&&&\text{1,610,000 }&\\
&\text{Patents and copyrights}&&&\underline{\text{~~~~~~~~660,000}}&\\
&\bold{Total~Assets}&&&\underline{\underline{\bold{\$~2,798,000}}}\\ \\

&\text{Accounts Payable}&&&210,000&\\
&\text{Notes Payable}&&&155,000&\\
&\text{Long-term debt}&&&\underline{~~~~~~~~~~830,000}&\\
&\text{Total~Liabilities}&&&\$~1,195,000\\ \\

&\text{Common Stock}&&&235,000&\\
&\text{Accumulated retained earnings}&&&\underline{\text{~~~~~~1,368,000 }}&\\
&\bold{Total~Liabilities~and~Equity}&&&\underline{\underline{\bold{\$~2,798,000 }}}
\end{aligned}
\end{array}$$
\
Common stock is a balancing figure so the total liabilities and equity will match the amount of total assets.
